avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed in high elevations after continuous SW and N winds, especially in gullies. Older snow is considered stable. Beware of terrain traps. Becoming warmer with rain on Saturday, potentially releasing wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Mostly light snow cover in the forecasting area, but windslabs can be found widely, especially in high elevations and in gullies after continuous SW and N winds. Snow pit in Skálafell showed now response on CT. Snow is widely wind packed and older snow is considered stable. Avalanches can still occur in places like gullies so beware of terrain traps. Warm temperatures and rain on Saturday can cause snow cover to change rapidly, increased chance of wet avalanche activity.

travelAdvisory.comment: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Snow scooter triggered avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. Weak layers can be present in other areas and people travelling in steep terrain should be very cautious. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austanátt á föstudag og kalt í veðri. Á laugardag snýr í SA-átt, hlýnar og fer að rigna, styttir upp á sunnudag og þurrt að mestu.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche fell in N-aspect in Súgandafjörður on Monday. Small collapses have been seen in W-facing hills this weekend. Two avalanches released in Súðavíkurhlíð on 6.2. in NW winds, one of them closed the road. Two avalanches fell on and right by the same road early on 3.2. after ongoing SW winds.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects. Observations indicate multiple weak layers in the snowpack and increased likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Compressions tests in the area gave a sudden collapse with medium load.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects and weaknesses have been found between layers. Snow pits in the area from the 7th, 8th and 10th of February confirm this and compression tests have given a sudden collapse at 10-40 cm depth. Even though there is still rather little snow in mountains for the season, people travelling in steep terrain should be careful. There is an increased risk of human triggered avalanches that can be dangerous. In the cold weather, weak layers should have been preserved.

travelAdvisory.comment: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Snow scooter triggered avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. Weak layers can be present in other areas and people travelling in steep terrain should be very cautious. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-átt og hlýnar á laugardag. Lítilsháttar rigning en snjókoma til fjalla. Áfram hlýtt á sunnudag en úrkomulítið.

avalancheActivity.comment: A 40 m wide and up to 1 m thick slab was triggered by a snowmobile in a steep S-facing hill 10.2. An avalanche was spotted in Auðnahyrna 8.2, probably from 7th of Feb. An avalanche was spotted in Skarðsdalsvik 7.2. on a west facing slope. A slab avalanche was spotted on Tuesday morning 7.2. in a south facing gully in Bakkadalur. A slab avalanche fell over the road Ólafsfjarðarvegur on 6.2 east facing. Earlier the same morning, an avalanche released in Ólafsfjarðarmúli, but it was smaller and stopped above the road.
avalancheActivity.highlights: About 40 m wide slab was triggered 10.2. in a steep S-facing hill in Upsadalur close to Dalvík. Unstable windslabs should be expected in steep slopes, both in southerly and northerly facing aspects. Whumps noticed widely in the forecasting area. Becoming warmer weather and thawing on Saturday and Sunday, potentially triggering avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs from northerly wind and snow early this week and S wind on Wednesday. Older and possibly unstable windslabs can be found in all aspects. A layered snowpack from snowpit (14.2) on Klettahjúkur by Siglufjörður with CT sudden planar collapse with medium load in NE face. Weak layer with facets deeper in snowpack. ECTP17 with planar fracture between a hard slab and the firn below in Vatnsendahnjúkur W-face in Héðinsfjörður 11.2 and some whumps noticed. Whumps noticed in Svarfaðadalur, Héðinsfjörður and Karlsárdalur and the sledge triggered slab in Upsadalur 10.2. show that persistent windslabs can be tricky. Avalanches can potentially be triggered by thawind on Saturday and Sunday and snow becomes wet in lower elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Snow scooter triggered avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. Weak layers can be present in other areas and people travelling in steep terrain should be very cautious. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur hæg suðlæg eða breytileg átt á föstudag, kalt og bjart í veðri en snýr svo í sunnanátt og hlánar á laugardag. Frostmarkshæð gæti náð hátt í 1000 m en kólnar lítillega aftur á sunnudag. Líkur á lítilsháttar úrkomu aðfaranótt sunnudags.

avalancheActivity.comment: Snow scooter triggered avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. Avalanches in N-aspect in Seyðisfjörður and S-aspect in Eskifjörður and Norðfjörður on Monday. Small avalanche in inner Bræðslugjá by Neskaupstaður from 7th or 8th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layer in snowpit in Oddsskarð on Wednesday. Much snow was been added on Sunday and Monday, especially around Seyðisfjörður. Windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Weak layer under stiff windslab was observed in snowpit in Oddsskarð on WednesdayMuch snow was been added on Sunday and Monday, especially around Seyðisfjörður and drifted in NE-E winds. Before were new windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers.

travelAdvisory.comment: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Snow scooter triggered avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður on Wednesday. Weak layers can be present in other areas and people travelling in steep terrain should be very cautious. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Weak layers have been observed in Eastfjords, Westfjord and in the north. Weak layers can be present in other areas. Warming widely over the weekend and the snow may become unstable to begin with.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-átt og hlýnar á laugardag. Rigning en snjókoma til fjalla. Áfram hlýtt á sunnudag en úrkomulítið.
